channel.title: Big Memory on Gregory Trubetskoy
channel.description: Recent content in Big Memory on Gregory Trubetskoy

item.title: On keeping lots of integers in memory
item.description: Once upon a time (over a year ago) I found myself needing to store large numbers of integers in memory. The goal was to store a graph of all our purchasers and items purchased, so that we could quickly identify like-minded purchasers based on common purchases and make real-time recommendations of the form “people like you also bought”. This approach is commonly known as collaborative filtering, and exactly how we did it would be a subject of some future post (perhaps).
